sentences: Chris White (born 13 July 1955) is an English jazz/rock saxophonist who toured with Dire Straits from 1985â€“1995, and who has played with many bands and artists, including Robbie Williams, Paul McCartney, Chris De Burgh and Mick Jagger.
He started gigging a couple of years later, and was soon playing in the National Youth Jazz Orchestra and touring with other musicians (such as France Gall).
He joined Dire Straits in 1985 for their two final world tours, and played at both the Live Aid concert and Nelson Mandela's 70th Birthday Concert in 1988.
In 2002 he joined the band again together with Mark Knopfler, Guy Fletcher, John Illsley and Danny Cummings in the four small reunion gigs in London and Beaulieu Abbey.
In 2007, White played with Tom Jones and Bryan Ferry at the Concert for Diana at Wembley Stadium.
